text: Michael Norman Shaw, Baron Shaw of Northstead (9 October 1920 – January 2021) was a British Conservative Party politician. He was a Member of Parliament (MP) from 1960 to 1964 and from 1966 to 1992. He was a member of the National Liberal, before becoming a Conservative. He was born in Leeds, West Yorkshire. From 1973 to 1979, he was a Member of the European Parliament. Shaw turned 100 in October 2020. He died three months later in January 2021.Michael Shaw, Baron Shaw of Northstead (S 30-34) 1920-2021 ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2021 deaths Category:UK MPs 1959–1964 Category:UK MPs 1966–1970 Category:UK MPs 1970–1974 Category:UK MPs 1974 Category:UK MPs 1974–1979 Category:UK MPs 1979–1983 Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:MEPs for the United Kingdom Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs Category:Politicians from Leeds
title: Michael Shaw, Baron Shaw of Northstead
